p:
SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV, and SARS-CoV-2 have strong human-to-human characteristics, which is attributed to the interaction between S protein and host cell surface receptors. SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 use the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) as a receptor
15
,
16 , whereas MERS-CoV uses dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4; also known as CD26) as a receptor
17 . The distribution of receptors in humans and their affinity with S proteins determine the extent of tissue tropism and the intensity of transmission of coronavirus. The epidemiology and biological characteristics of SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are summarized in Table 1 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 ,
12
, 15, 16, 17.
